subject: Communication
title: What Is Culture, Really?
description: Learn What Is Culture, Really? in one minute.

hook.text: A fish doesn't know it's in water. You don't know you're in a culture â€” until you leave it.

buildup.text: Culture is the invisible operating system of shared beliefs, values, norms, and practices that shape behavior.

discovery.text: Edward T. Hall called culture an iceberg: only 10% is visible (food, dress). The 90% below is values and assumptions.

twist.text: Most cross-cultural misunderstandings happen in the invisible 90% â€” not the obvious surface differences.

climax.text: Understanding culture means learning to see the invisible rules that everyone follows but nobody discusses.

punchline.text: Culture is invisible â€” until it collides with another.
